args.name: name
args.doc: Specifies the identifier(...) The identifier must start with an alphabetic character and cannot contain spaces or special characters unless the entire identifier string is enclosed in double quotes (for example, “My object”). Identifiers enclosed in double quotes are also case-sensitive

args.name: arg_name
args.doc: Specify the name of the input argument.

args.name: arg_data_type
args.doc: Use the Snowflake data type that corresponds to the handler language that you are using

args.name: default_value
args.doc: To indicate that an argument is optional, use DEFAULT default_value to specify the default value of the argument. For the default value, you can use a literal or an expression.

args.name: returns
args.doc: Specifies the results returned by the UDF, which determines the UDF type

args.name: language
args.doc: (carl: the language of the function, default null means SQL)

args.name: runtime_version
args.doc: runtime version to use

args.name: comment
args.doc: Specifies a comment for the UDF, which is displayed in the DESCRIPTION column in the SHOW FUNCTIONS and SHOW USER FUNCTIONS output. Default: user-defined function

args.name: imports
args.doc: The location (stage), path, and name of the file(s) to import, such as a JAR or other kind of file.

args.name: packages
args.doc: The name and version number of Snowflake system packages required as dependencies. The value should be of the form package_name:version_number, where package_name is snowflake_domain:package

args.name: handler
args.doc: The name of the handler method or class

args.name: external_access_integrations
args.doc: The names of external access integrations needed in order for this function’s handler code to access external networks. An external access integration specifies network rules and secrets that specify external locations and credentials (if any) allowed for use by handler code when making requests of an external network, such as an external REST API.

args.name: secrets
args.doc: Assigns the names of secrets to variables so that you can use the variables to reference the secrets when retrieving information from secrets in handler code

args.name: function_definition
args.doc: (AS) Defines the handler code executed when the UDF is called. The function_definition value must be source code in one of the languages supported for handlers (or SQL).

args.name: SECURE
args.doc: Specifies that the function is secure. For more information about secure functions, see Protecting Sensitive Information with Secure UDFs and Stored Procedures.

args.name: AGGREGATE
args.doc: Specifies that the function is an aggregate function

args.name: TEMP
args.doc: Specifies that the function persists only for the duration of the session that you created it in. A temporary function is dropped at the end of the session.

args.name: COPY GRANTS
args.doc: Specifies to retain the access privileges from the original function when a new function is created using CREATE OR REPLACE FUNCTION.

args.name: CALLED ON NULL INPUT
args.doc: Specifies the behavior of the UDF when called with null inputs. In contrast to system-defined functions, which always return null when any input is null, UDFs can handle null inputs, returning non-null values even when an input is null

args.name: RETURNS NULL ON NULL INPUT
args.doc: (or its synonym STRICT) will not call the UDF if any input is null. Instead, a null value will always be returned for that row. Note that the UDF might still return null for non-null inputs.

args.name: VOLATILE
args.doc: UDF might return different values for different rows, even for the same input (e.g. due to non-determinism and statefullness

args.name: IMMUTABLE
args.doc: UDF assumes that the function, when called with the same inputs, will always return the same result. This guarantee is not checked. Specifying IMMUTABLE for a UDF that returns different values for the same input will result in undefined behavior.

fields.name: DATA_TYPE
fields.doc: carl: im pretty sure this is the returns argument given, e.g. table function, float (scalar) etc.

fields.name: FUNCTION_LANGUAGE
fields.doc: (carl: the language of the function, default null means SQL, but can be Python etc)

fields.name: FUNCTION_DEFINITION
fields.doc: (AS) Defines the handler code executed when the UDF is called. The function_definition value must be source code in one of the languages supported for handlers (or SQL).

fields.name: VOLATILITY
fields.doc: UDF might return different values for different rows, even for the same input (e.g. due to non-determinism and statefullness

fields.name: IS_SECURE
fields.doc: Specifies that the function is secure. For more information about secure functions, see Protecting Sensitive Information with Secure UDFs and Stored Procedures.

fields.name: COMMENT
fields.doc: Specifies a comment for the UDF, which is displayed in the DESCRIPTION column in the SHOW FUNCTIONS and SHOW USER FUNCTIONS output. Default: user-defined function

fields.name: IMPORTS
fields.doc: The location (stage), path, and name of the file(s) to import, such as a JAR or other kind of file.

fields.name: HANDLER
fields.doc: The name of the handler method or class

fields.name: PACKAGES
fields.doc: The name and version number of Snowflake system packages required as dependencies. The value should be of the form package_name:version_number, where package_name is snowflake_domain:package

fields.name: EXTERNAL_ACCESS_INTEGRATIONS
fields.doc: The names of external access integrations needed in order for this function’s handler code to access external networks. An external access integration specifies network rules and secrets that specify external locations and credentials (if any) allowed for use by handler code when making requests of an external network, such as an external REST API.

fields.name: SECRETS
fields.doc: Assigns the names of secrets to variables so that you can use the variables to reference the secrets when retrieving information from secrets in handler code

fields.name: IS_AGGREGATE
fields.doc: Specifies that the function is an aggregate function

args.name: name
args.doc: Identifier for the user; must be unique for your account.

args.name: PASSWORD
args.doc: The password for the user must be enclosed in single or double quotes. If no password is specified, the user cannot log into Snowflake until a password has been explicitly specified for them.

args.name: LOGIN_NAME
args.doc: Name that the user enters to log into the system. Login names for users must be unique across your entire account.

args.name: DISPLAY_NAME
args.doc: Name displayed for the user in the Snowflake web interface.

args.name: FIRST_NAME
args.doc: first name

args.name: MIDDLE_NAME
args.doc: middle name

args.name: LAST_NAME
args.doc: last name

args.name: EMAIL
args.doc: Email address for the user.

args.name: MUST_CHANGE_PASSWORD
args.doc: Specifies whether the user is forced to change their password on next login (including their first/initial login) into the system.

args.name: DISABLED
args.doc: Specifies whether the user is disabled

args.name: DAYS_TO_EXPIRY
args.doc: Specifies the number of days after which the user status is set to “Expired” and the user is no longer allowed to log in.

args.name: MINS_TO_UNLOCK
args.doc: Specifies the number of minutes until the temporary lock on the user login is cleared. To protect against unauthorized user login, Snowflake places a temporary lock on a user after five consecutive unsuccessful login attempts

args.name: DEFAULT_WAREHOUSE
args.doc: Specifies the virtual warehouse that is active by default for the user’s session upon login.

args.name: DEFAULT_NAMESPACE
args.doc: Specifies the namespace (database only or database and schema) that is active by default for the user’s session upon login

args.name: DEFAULT_ROLE
args.doc: Specifies the primary role that is active by default for the user’s session upon login.

args.name: DEFAULT_SECONDARY_ROLES
args.doc: Specifies the set of secondary roles that are active for the user’s session upon login. Secondary roles are a set of roles that authorize any SQL action other than the execution of CREATE <object> statements

args.name: MINS_TO_BYPASS_MFA
args.doc: Specifies the number of minutes to temporarily bypass MFA for the user.

args.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY
args.doc: pecifies the user’s RSA public key; used for key pair authentication.

args.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_FP
args.doc: Specifies the fingerprint of the user’s RSA public key; used for key pair authentication.

args.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_2
args.doc: Specifies the user’s second RSA public key; used to rotate the public and private keys for key pair authentication based on an expiration schedule set by your organization.

args.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_2_FP
args.doc: Specifies the fingerprint of the user’s second RSA public key; used to rotate the public and private keys for key pair authentication based on an expiration schedule set by your organization.

args.name: TYPE
args.doc: Specifies the type of user. You can set this property to differentiate between human, service, and legacy service users.

args.name: COMMENT
args.doc: Specifies a comment for the user. Default: NULL

args.name: ENABLE_UNREDACTED_QUERY_SYNTAX_ERROR
args.doc: Controls how queries that fail due to syntax or parsing errors show up in a query history.

args.name: NETWORK_POLICY
args.doc: Specifies an existing network policy is active for the user. The network policy restricts the list of user IP addresses when exchanging an authorization code for an access or refresh token and when using a refresh token to obtain a new access token.

args.name: ABORT_DETACHED_QUERY
args.doc: N/A

args.name: AUTOCOMMIT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: BINARY_INPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: BINARY_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: DATE_INPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: DATE_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: ERROR_ON_NONDETERMINISTIC_MERGE
args.doc: N/A

args.name: ERROR_ON_NONDETERMINISTIC_UPDATE
args.doc: N/A

args.name: JSON_INDENT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: LOCK_TIMEOUT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: QUERY_TAG
args.doc: N/A

args.name: ROWS_PER_RESULTSET
args.doc: N/A

args.name: SIMULATED_DATA_SHARING_CONSUMER
args.doc: N/A

args.name: STATEMENT_TIMEOUT_IN_SECONDS
args.doc: N/A

args.name: STRICT_JSON_OUTPUT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_DAY_IS_ALWAYS_24H
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_INPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_LTZ_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_NTZ_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_TYPE_MAPPING
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMESTAMP_TZ_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIMEZONE
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIME_INPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TIME_OUTPUT_FORMAT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TRANSACTION_DEFAULT_ISOLATION_LEVEL
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TWO_DIGIT_CENTURY_START
args.doc: N/A

args.name: UNSUPPORTED_DDL_ACTION
args.doc: N/A

args.name: USE_CACHED_RESULT
args.doc: N/A

args.name: WEEK_OF_YEAR_POLICY
args.doc: N/A

args.name: WEEK_START
args.doc: N/A

args.name: TAG
args.doc: Specifies the tag name and the tag string value.

fields.name: COMMENT
fields.doc: Specifies a comment for the UDF, which is displayed in the DESCRIPTION column in the SHOW FUNCTIONS and SHOW USER FUNCTIONS output. Default: user-defined function

fields.name: DISPLAY_NAME
fields.doc: Display name of the associated object

fields.name: TYPE
fields.doc: Type of the account, data exchange, data exchange listing, replication group, secret, network rule, or user.

fields.name: SNOWFLAKE_LOCK
fields.doc: Whether the user, account, or organization is locked by Snowflake

fields.name: SNOWFLAKE_SUPPORT
fields.doc: Snowflake Support is allowed to use the user or account

fields.name: DAYS_TO_EXPIRY
fields.doc: User record will be treated as expired after specified number of days

fields.name: MINS_TO_UNLOCK
fields.doc: Temporary lock on the user will be removed after specified number of minutes

fields.name: DEFAULT_NAMESPACE
fields.doc: Default database namespace prefix for this user

fields.name: DEFAULT_ROLE
fields.doc: Primary principal of user session will be set to this role

fields.name: DEFAULT_SECONDARY_ROLES
fields.doc: The secondary roles will be set to all roles provided here.

fields.name: EXT_AUTHN_DUO
fields.doc: Whether Duo Security is enabled as second-factor authentication

fields.name: EXT_AUTHN_UID
fields.doc: External authentication ID of the user

fields.name: HAS_MFA
fields.doc: Whether the user is enrolled in multi-factor authentication

fields.name: MINS_TO_BYPASS_MFA
fields.doc: Temporary bypass MFA for the user for a specified number of minutes

fields.name: MINS_TO_BYPASS_NETWORK_POLICY
fields.doc: Temporary bypass network policy on the user for a specified number of minutes

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY
fields.doc: RSA public key of the user

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_FP
fields.doc: Fingerprint of user's RSA public key.

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_LAST_SET_TIME
fields.doc: The timestamp at which the RSA public key was last set for the user. Defaults to null if no RSA public key has been set yet.

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_2
fields.doc: Second RSA public key of the user

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_2_FP
fields.doc: Fingerprint of user's second RSA public key.

fields.name: RSA_PUBLIC_KEY_2_LAST_SET_TIME
fields.doc: The timestamp at which the second RSA public key was last set for the user. Defaults to null if no second RSA public key has been set yet.

fields.name: PASSWORD_LAST_SET_TIME
fields.doc: The timestamp on which the last non-null password was set for the user. Default to null if no password has been set yet.

fields.name: CUSTOM_LANDING_PAGE_URL
fields.doc: Custom Landing Page of the user

fields.name: CUSTOM_LANDING_PAGE_URL_FLUSH_NEXT_UI_LOAD
fields.doc: Whether or not to flush the custom landing page of the user on next UI load

args.name: name
args.doc: Identifier for the role; must be unique for your account.

args.name: comment
args.doc: Specifies a comment for the role. Default: No value

args.name: tag
args.doc: Specifies the tag name and the tag string value.

fields.name: NAME
fields.doc: Identifier for the role; must be unique for your account.

fields.name: COMMENT
fields.doc: Specifies a comment for the role. Default: No value
